snippet.title: Duolingo Takes Online Teaching To The Next Level, By Crowd Sourcing New Languages
snippet.description: After providing the first six languages it expects to get dozens more from volunteers in the coming months, including Chinese, Russian, even Klingon. read »

snippet.title: American Political Economy Is No Different From English Language
snippet.description: Language is purely a means of exchange. The market is no different. read »

snippet.title: Germany's Pirate Party: Technocrats With A New Purpose #refugeecamp
snippet.description: Frankfurt Skyline - Image By @rUv For those who know me, know I travel a lot. According to the Star Alliance something in the order of 50,000 miles in October alone. As I travel, I enjoy meeting with people involved in various local technology scenes. Earlier today I had the chance [...] read »

snippet.title: Gender, Sex and Games: A New Lara Croft Hits An Old, Old Problem
snippet.description: A 'preboot' of the iconic Tomb Raider franchise features a younger, more vulnerable Lara Croft - but the way that vulnerability is expressed raises thorny issues around sex and the creative process. read »

snippet.title: The Changing Face of Games: Feeling Angry and Ignored, Fans Look for Someone to Blame
snippet.description: Video Mass of angry gamers, more like Until recently Jennifer Brandes Hepler, a writer at BioWare, Electronic Arts' role-playing game subsidiary, was little-known outside the inner circle of BioWare fandom. Within those small circles, Hepler had for some time been a polarising figure. Or, more precisely, a kind of hypothetical Jennifer Hepler [...] read »
